title: Tsyhan
author: Tsyhan
content: Hi, how can i make one transaction with 5 outputs sent to the same output address, must be same transaction id and same XMR address. But 5 outputs. How can i do it in the Feather wallet, or some another wallet.thanks!

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: I don't know how to do it using feather wallet, this might the first time I heard this wallet too. It seems impossible if you want to send to a same address, but you ask for multiple outputs in one transaction.Based on my research you can only transfer to different addresses using GUI wallet or CLI wallet, which is come from official Monero website [1]. This one is the guide if you use GUI wallet [2] and this one is the guide if you use CLI wallet [3].[1] https://www.getmonero.org/downloads/[2] https://github.com/monero-project/monero-gui/issues/740[3] https://monero.stackexchange.com/questions/4021/how-do-i-send-xmr-to-multiple-different-addresses

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Tsyhan on July 05, 2023, 03:53:47 PMHi, how can i make one transaction with 5 outputs sent to the same output address, I did not understand your question. Do you mean that these 5 outputs belong to the same wallet, if that is, you are re-sent to your wallet, and here all Monero wallets support this, or are they for new outputs or different addresses.If the addresses are different, you have some options. Use the CLI wallet[1], where using the commands you can create a transaction and specify the number of output pairs, or use the Feather wallet[2].[1] https://www.getmonero.org/downloads/[2] https://featherwallet.org/

comments.author: Tsyhan
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on July 06, 2023, 09:02:55 AMQuote from: Tsyhan on July 05, 2023, 03:53:47 PMHi, how can i make one transaction with 5 outputs sent to the same output address, I did not understand your question. Do you mean that these 5 outputs belong to the same wallet, if that is, you are re-sent to your wallet, and here all Monero wallets support this, or are they for new outputs or different addresses.If the addresses are different, you have some options. Use the CLI wallet[1], where using the commands you can create a transaction and specify the number of output pairs, or use the Feather wallet[2].[1] https://www.getmonero.org/downloads/[2] https://featherwallet.org/Hi yes it must be the same wallet, 5 same value transactions to the same address. I am found tools in Feather wallet >> pay to many. It's worked. Not sure that in right way but worked.

comments.author: jrrsparkles
comments.body: Quote from: Tsyhan on July 08, 2023, 06:52:57 PMQuote from: hugeblack on July 06, 2023, 09:02:55 AMQuote from: Tsyhan on July 05, 2023, 03:53:47 PMHi, how can i make one transaction with 5 outputs sent to the same output address, I did not understand your question. Do you mean that these 5 outputs belong to the same wallet, if that is, you are re-sent to your wallet, and here all Monero wallets support this, or are they for new outputs or different addresses.If the addresses are different, you have some options. Use the CLI wallet[1], where using the commands you can create a transaction and specify the number of output pairs, or use the Feather wallet[2].[1] https://www.getmonero.org/downloads/[2] https://featherwallet.org/Hi yes it must be the same wallet, 5 same value transactions to the same address. I am found tools in Feather wallet >> pay to many. It's worked. Not sure that in right way but worked.You mean, you entered the same destination address as five different outputs so that the wallet can make a transaction with 5 output to the same address irrespective of the transacted amount to each address.I find its little odd, cause it's not possible with other wallets if I am not wrong cause once you enter an address and try to enter the same address it will just select the previously entered one instead of creating new one everytime.

comments.author: FinneysTrueVision
comments.body: Quote from: Tsyhan on July 08, 2023, 06:52:57 PMQuote from: hugeblack on July 06, 2023, 09:02:55 AMQuote from: Tsyhan on July 05, 2023, 03:53:47 PMHi, how can i make one transaction with 5 outputs sent to the same output address, I did not understand your question. Do you mean that these 5 outputs belong to the same wallet, if that is, you are re-sent to your wallet, and here all Monero wallets support this, or are they for new outputs or different addresses.If the addresses are different, you have some options. Use the CLI wallet[1], where using the commands you can create a transaction and specify the number of output pairs, or use the Feather wallet[2].https://featherwallet.org/img/receive_light.png[1] https://www.getmonero.org/downloads/[2] https://featherwallet.org/Hi yes it must be the same wallet, 5 same value transactions to the same address. I am found tools in Feather wallet >> pay to many. It's worked. Not sure that in right way but worked.The pay to many feature is the correct way to do this. In the pay to field you would enter the destination address and payment amount separated by a comma. Then repeat this 4 more times on separate lines.
